alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Pointe Coupee; West Feliciana (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 9:16PM CDT until May 05 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Mississippi River At Red River Landing affecting West Feliciana, East Baton Rouge and Pointe Coupee Parishes. For the Lower Mississippi River...including Red River Landing... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY, MAY 05... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River At Red River Landing. * WHEN...Until Thursday, May 05. * IMPACTS...At 51.0 feet, All river islands along the reach from Red River Landing to Baton Rouge will be inundated. Recreational camps and river bottom farm land will be under water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 47.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 51.0 feet Monday, April 25. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday, May 05. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 51.4 feet on 06/01/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued Monday morning.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; Pointe Coupee; West Feliciana
